title: An Oasis in the City
amenities: {TV,Kitchen,Elevator,Buzzer/wireless intercom,Heating,Washer,Smoke detector,Fire extinguisher,Essentials,Hangers,Hair dryer,Iron,Bed linens,Extra pillows and blankets,Microwave,Refrigerator,Dishwasher,Dishes and silverware,Cooking basics,Stove,Single level home,Patio or balcony,Garden or backyard}
description: Very central to the city which can be reached by an easy walk or by bus, with transport at the door, if required, and all amenities within easy reach. Potts Pt. is a vibrant  and popular inner-city suburb & the area was described as 'Australia's Bohemian Heart' in the article by Raymond Bonner in the New York Times . Ultra-convenient & within walking distance of the central business district  & all tourist sites such as:  the Botanic Gardens,  Opera House,  NSW Art Gallery,  Australian Museum,   Circular Quay, the Sydney Opera House, and BridgeClimb Darling Harbour Museum of Contemporary Art Art Gallery of NSW Sydney Museum Hyde Park Botanic Gardens Chinatown, Paddy's Markets, and the Chinese Gardens Paddington (& the Saturday markets) The historic Rocks area (& the markets on Saturday & Sunday) It is 7 minutes walk to the Kings Cross.train (Metro) station & buses to the beaches .  Bus to/from city leaves from across the road (and it takes about 15-20 minutes to walk to Circular  Quay
notes: $150.00 key security deposit, refundable on return of  rhe keys.    The Supermarket, 100 metres up the road, is open until midnight and has free wifi and the  Library is 10 minutes up the road and has free WiFi, as do many cafes etc. On Sunday travel on the Opal travel card (covering buses, trains and ferries) costs a maximum of $2.50, a great bargain.

reviews.review_content: I really enjoyed my stay in Sydney at Colleen’s place.  It was very clean and she had lots of maps and tour pamphlets to help get me around the city.
Colleen knows a lot about Sydney and is willing to help. Room has space.

Colleen’s place is well appointed, close to public transport and nice walks; and overall very interesting. Colleen has a wealth of hosting and life experience. She is v understanding and trustworthy. I highly recommend this place to travellers who respect a broader view of life, and who want a central, elegant location.
It was a fantastic place with a lot of character and the area is just beautiful. Colleen is a great host that knows Sydney better then anyone.

Colleen was a wonderful host! She’s lived such an amazing life and is full of great anecdotes. 
The flat is so lovely and home-y and really is an oasis in the center of the city!

The location is perfect for a first time in Sydney, as it’s so close to buses and trains that easily connect you to any suburb you might want to visit! Plus, it’s within walking distance of the Opera House!

I had an amazing stay with Colleen and cannot recommend her apartment more!
Colleen is a lovely and helpful host, and her apartment is in a great spot. She shares the whole space generously, and is so helpful for finding your way around Sydney.
Everything is completely uncomplicated and the location speaks for itself ... I can only recommend a stay with Colleen.
A wonderful and easy stay in Colleen’s home. Very comfortable, convenient and felt very welcomed in her home. Perfect location and some great little cafes around. Great for a solo traveller.

Colleen made me feel very comfortable from the first second. She has very good Tipps. Busstop just in front of the house. Very easy to reach everything. Close to botanical gardens, nice cafes and restaurants very close. I would definitely stay at Colleens place again.

Colleen has always been very kind and polite to me. She is an extremely friendly and helpful person. In addition, he always offers advice on Sydney's tourist attractions. I do not rule out that if I ever come to Sydney again I will gladly visit Colleen. I would definitely recommend this host. Edmund
